ratings.comment: Almost impossible to understand. He goes off on tangents, does not give clear explanations to his students or TA's (they were just as lost as we were throughout the semester.) Does not give any information about the exams prior to the exam date. Has unreasonable expectations for dissecting musical compositions.

Pretty good professor, I don't really have any complaints. The class itself is very easy as long as you read. Quizzes focused on terms and concepts from the reading mostly, your discussion group does a good job at preparing you for those. The tests focus more on the listenings in class and in the reading as well as the timeline of the reading.
The class was awesome. If you are a history buff and like music, you'll love this class!

Didn't enjoy this class. Took it for an easy A while in harder courses but wasn't as easy as would have liked. Lecture is useless, though the professor is kind of funny. No books. Just read the material and memorize it a day or two before the test/quiz. Would not recommend b/c it is a bad class  but isn't that difficult.

Two exams, worth the same. No final. Second exam is not cumulative. It's a lot of history, and it can be really boring. You do listen to some music, and he tells you beforehand which ones he expects you to be able to identify upon hearing it. He doesn't always seem the nicest. I've heard him say some demeaning stuff. The TAs are pretty awesome.
fantastic. wonderful, dry sense of humor. engaging lecturer, and incredibly fair exams. come for the music history, stay for his fantastic singing voice.

Take this class with a different instructor. I have heard that other Music 101's are very interesting. We spent the first month analyzing gregorian chants, thats just as fun as it sounds. It's not a difficult class but it could definitely be taught much more excitingly.

Animated but somewhat scattered lecturer. Uses PowerPoint and plays a lot of examples. Textbook is free PDFs with class notes. Two exams (second is much easier), four quizzes in section. Pretty easy class, but you do need to pay attention in class and/or read the notes.

You don't need to go to lecture, I would try to get the notes from someone but if you can't it's not that big of a deal b/c the course reader online has basically the same info. There's a midterm and a final, both worth the same (final isn't cumulative). The 2nd half of class is way easier than 1st. 4 quizzes throughout the sem. Reallly easy class.

I stopped going to lecture after the midterm, and I ended up getting an AB in the class. Lecture is not required by any means. Everything you need to know for the exam is in the packet he posts online. I personally hated the class because it was just a lot of boring history. Studying for the exam is a must, but memorization is the best way to do it

This class was super easy, and super interesting too.  I loved it, and I'd definitely recommend it to anyone.  Everything you need to know is in the packet for the class, and you probably don't even have to go to lecture all that often if you don't want to.  Professor Earp is pretty crazy, but it's funny and he's very knowledgable as well.
This guy was great.  He had the craziest gestures, picked out great pieces of music and was an entertaining lecturer.
Too hard for an intro music course.  You never know what will show up on exams...the only good part about it, is the TAs.
